content.body: Do we define what "present" means when it comes to AO params? Eg, I want to call https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/ordinary-and-exotic-objects-behaviours.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction and pass `prefix`, but don't want to pass `realm` or `prototype`.
content.formatted_body: Do we define what "present" means when it comes to AO params? Eg, I want to call https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/ordinary-and-exotic-objects-behaviours.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction and pass prefix, but don't want to pass realm or prototype.

content.body: Can I pass `empty`, and have these not be "present"
content.formatted_body: Can I pass empty, and have these not be "present"

content.body: I don't think we have spec syntax for that, but it seems like it'll just be two lines of copy pasta to hack through it...
in `Foo(_a_)` vs `Foo(_a_, _b_)`, b is not present in the first call. you have to branch and do two different invocations to the AO if you want to trigger "not present".
content.formatted_body: in Foo(_a_) vs Foo(_a_, _b_), b is not present in the first call. you have to branch and do two different invocations to the AO if you want to trigger "not present".

content.body: It's not in https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/notational-conventions.html#sec-notational-conventions, where I expected it
